sentences.sContent: Miners have complained bitterly that the government did not fulfil their promises.
sentences.sCn: 矿工们已愤愤地抱怨政府没有兑现他们的承诺。

sentences.sContent: The couple complained about the high cost of visiting Europe.
sentences.sCn: 这对夫妇抱怨了游览欧洲的高昂花费。

sentences.sContent: I shouldn't complain, I've got a good job to go back to.
sentences.sCn: 我不该抱怨，我已有可回去干的一份好工作。

sentences.sContent: "I wish someone would do something about it," he complained.
sentences.sCn: “我希望有人能对此做点什么，”他抱怨道。

sentences.sContent: ...but people still complain about their Internet being too slow...

...Loosely managed teams can become hotbeds of distraction―employees routinely complain that they can’t get their work done because they are forced to spend too much time in meetings or compelled to work in noisy offices...
...many complain that their school libraries do not have enough up-to-date interesting books and magazines...
...it often helps to complain by letter...
...Why does the speaker say the worst way to complain is over the telephone...
...The way to complain is to act business-like and important...
...The way to complain is to act business-like and important...
...Why does the speaker say the worst way to complain is over the telephone...
...The worst way to complain is over the telephone...
...every unhappy customer will complain to at least four other...
...but actually keeping customers happy is easier said than done Shoppers seldom complain to the manager or owner of a retail store...

remMethod.val: com ＋ plain(平常的) → 不要抱怨生活的平淡 → 抱怨

words.tran: 抱怨地；发牢骚地；诉苦地
[法] 原告；发牢骚的人；抱怨者

trans.tranCn: 抱怨， 诉苦； 控告， 投诉
trans.tranOther: If you complain about a situation, you say that you are not satisfied with it
